topics.body:
I personally think the lightsaber hilt thing looks perfectly fine. With my experiences in fencing, I've held blades with hilts that have protrusions like the lightsaber does. It does not get in the way at all if you have a correct grip on the blade. The hilt should never touch you. And yes, the hilt can possibly be used for effective protection.

I love when people on the internet pretend to know so much about blades.
topics.author: 9ba2e84e636164642cc03200

topics.body:
"@EHAN":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/547f64316368726271070000#post_547f64316368726271070000
The thing people forget about star wars is that there are metals specifically made so that lightsabers can't cut through them; even one jedi had a actual metal sword.  Also don't forget the light whip.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
